private_information: I know the informal action schemas for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the predicates referenced in the use-case
I have access to the two scenario initial statements and the two goals described in the use-case
I can produce structured stepwise plans and operator descriptions but I will not emit final PDDL unless asked
planner.goal: Produce a coherent partial plan and operator-level descriptions that attempt to achieve the stated goals from the given initial facts while respecting action preconditions and effects

private_information: I can simulate state transitions by applying operator preconditions and effects
I validate whether a candidate step preserves logical preconditions required by downstream steps and detect inconsistent or impossible transitions
simulator.goal: Simulate the planner's partial plan(s), produce a state trace and flag unsatisfied preconditions and state conflicts

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or ad hoc state hacks
I transform plans and operator descriptions into causally explicit versions and identify where bookkeeping was used to hide missing causal links
consistency_auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that corrects or annotates the planner and simulator outputs to ensure causal and temporal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts

private_information: I integrate inputs from other agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver
When integrating I must keep actions conceptually distinct between agents that produced them and resolve naming mismatches
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the planner, simulator and auditor outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards that encodes the scenarios and goals

public_information: Predicates appearing in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, collect, spring, stupendous and others referenced in action schemas
Actions available are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with precondition and effect patterns described in the use-case
Two separate scenario statements with their initial facts and goals are available for planning and must be considered when producing plans
The orchestrator must produce PDDL suitable for FastDownwards and keep multi-agent action distinctions explicit

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain planning expert tasked with reading the action descriptions and the scenario statements and producing structured partial plans and operator descriptions without emitting final PDDL
analyze.prompt: Your role is planner. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private facts {agents->planner->private_information} and the global goal(s) {agents->planner->goal} to produce a stepwise candidate plan and compact operator descriptions listing preconditions and effects for each action instance referenced in planned steps. Do not emit full PDDL. Provide clear mapping from objects mentioned in the scenarios to operator placeholders.

simulate.system_prompt: You are a simulation expert who validates plans by applying operator preconditions and effects to the initial state and producing a deterministic state trace and a list of failures if any
simulate.prompt: Your role is simulator. Use the planner analysis {analysis_planner}, the public information {environment->public_information}, and your private facts {agents->simulator->private_information} to simulate the candidate plan(s). Produce a state-by-step trace of predicates after each action, flag missing preconditions, report conflicts, and summarize whether the plan achieves the stated goals given the initial facts.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency who must remove bookkeeping shortcuts and produce causally explicit operator variants and corrections. You never produce final PDDL but you provide transformations and annotations the orchestrator can use.
audit.prompt: Your role is consistency_auditor. Use the planner analysis {analysis_planner} and the simulation results {simulation_report} together with your private facts {agents->consistency_auditor->private_information} to produce an audit report that corrects shortcuts, introduces explicit causal links when needed, annotates required intermediate predicates, and outputs modified operator descriptions suitable for PDDL encoding.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and must integrate the planner, simulator, and auditor outputs and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted to the FastDownwards solver. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags and ensure multi-agent actions and any renamed objects are kept distinct.
pddl.prompt: Your role is orchestrator. Integrate the planner output {analysis_planner}, the simulator trace {simulation_report}, and the auditor corrections {audit_report} to produce a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards. Keep action names and agent-specific distinctions explicit. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
